Key Match Events: The Knicks shot a porous 4 of 22 from 3-point land, which highlights Orlando’s tough defense.
New York didn’t hit a single second-half three until Cameron Payne‘s meaningless bucket with just 8.2 seconds left—well beyond the point it mattered.
Post-Match Reflections: Honestly, the New York Knicks look tired.

Thibodeau would be wise to start sprinkling in Tyler Kolek and others before we reach that point. Considering we’re still in early January, and the team looks this sluggish, signals some troublesome signs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orlando Magic entered the game without a single double-digit scorer on the healthy books.
Cole Anthony, the son of former Knicks point guard Greg Anthony, scored a team-high 24 points on 50% shooting including 3 of 6 from beyond the arc.
Others: Karl-Anthony Towns warmed up before the game but decided to sit this one out with the hamstring injury he sustained in the Knicks’ loss to the Chicago Bulls.
Duece McBride who also missed the Magic loss.
